ud7.4:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ud7.4:1.3: Now at that time most of the people in Sāvatthī clung to sensual pleasures. Lustful, greedy, tied, infatuated, attached, and blinded, they lived completely addicted to sensual pleasures.
ud7.4:2.1: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Sāvatthī for alms.
ud7.4:2.2: He saw how attached the people were.
ud7.4:3.1: Then, knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
